snippet: Families face new feelings of grief and anger over possibly missed warnings of problems with the vehicles’ ignition switches.
abstract: Recall of 1.6 million cars by General Motors has prompted accident victims, their relatives and authorities across country to re-examine crashes in which faulty ignition switches may have played a role; company says that only 12 accidents are associated with recalled vehicles, and that none occurred after 2009, but it has provided no evidence for claim.

byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic contributed reporting from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: Families face new feelings of grief and anger over possibly missed warnings of problems with the vehicles’ ignition switches.

headline.main: Huge Recall by G.M. Sets Off Painful Questions on Crashes
headline.print_headline: Huge Recall by G.M. Sets Off Painful Questions on Crashes
